thread.title: Trump update: Speier nominates fired Yates for courage award
thread.title_full: Trump update: Speier nominates fired Yates for courage award

author: Evan Sernoffsky
title: Trump update: Speier nominates fired Yates for courage award
text:
By Evan Sernoffsky , San Francisco Chronicle Updated 8:00 am, Wednesday, February 1, 2017 Photo: Tom Williams/CQ Roll Call / / Image 1 of / 1 Close Image 1 of 1 Rep. Jackie Speier, D-Calif., attends a news conference on January 6, 2016. On Tuesday, Speier nominated fired acting Attorney General Sally Yates for the John F. Kennedy Profile in Courage Award. Rep. Jackie Speier, D-Calif., attends a news conference on January 6, 2016. On Tuesday, Speier nominated fired acting Attorney General Sally Yates for the John F. Kennedy Profile in Courage Award. Photo: Tom Williams/CQ Roll Call / / Trump update: Speier nominates fired Yates for courage award 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
Local congresswoman Jackie Speier, D-Hillsborough, nominated Sally Yates for the John F. Kennedy Profile in Courage Award the day after President Trump fired her as acting Attorney General. 
Yates was canned Monday after she refused to defend Trump’s executive order temporarily banning citizens of seven Muslim-majority countries and all refugees from entering the United States. 
Trump in recent days rolled back some of terms of the quickly written order - including banning residents with green cards. He signed the order Friday without review by members of congress or top counter-terrorism officials. 
The ban caused chaos and confusion at airports: 
•At San Francisco International Airport — as federal customs enforcement officials scrambled to understand and implement the ambiguous order.
